It's not too crowded or rowdy as many other bars in the area and offers a great selection of food and drinks. It checks the box between sports bar and fancy restaurant, giving the best of both worlds

We all agreed that this would be our new fave casual spot to grab dinner and drinks because the food was delish and the drinks weren't too pricey ($13$-15). We all loved the Mac n cheese & the nachos with steak added, the nachos were incredible!!! The portions were great and everything could be shared. For my entree, I got the branzino and I could go there every day to eat this meal - it was that good!
Delicious clam and toast!! Their new menu is to die for. Love the ambience and service. I know i'll be back to try the rosemary fries...

This restaurant is located on a busy street corner which I personally didn't mind-- despite sitting outside, the noise level wasn't bad. One critique was that the outdoor chairs were particularly uncomfortable. With that said, our waitress was exceptionally kind and helpful, snd the food was generally acceptable. The burgers were greasy (nothing special), but the kale salad was quite good. I'd say the salmon was a touch undercooked. You have to get the cast iron cookie if you eat here.. its easily the best thing on the menu!
Love this place. Friday night, sitting outside. Great social and food. Drinks, food, service in the city, can't beat it. Great night. We will be back.

The size of the restaurant is pretty large for the neighborhood so you don't feel cramped. Outdoor seating is great along first street separated from foot traffic by a little sidewalk garden. This place was great! My sister and I were in the neighborhood and wanted to get brunch but needed to sit outside because she had her dog. We went to two places prior. The first place was a 2.5 hour wait. The second place wouldn't let her bring her dog in. So we walked a block down and saw Boulton & Watt and they had brunch and outdoor seating available. We sat down immediately. They even offered a bowl of water for the dog, which they brought in an actual little dog bowl. Clearly they are dog friendly. The food was fantastic and the coffee was awesome. I had "The Hangover Sandwich" with rosemary fries. It was amazing. If I'm ever in the neighborhood again we will definitely be back!

I had always heard about this place being a fun spot so I decided to head over with some friends to check it out because we were in desperate need of food and drink. We arrived on a Friday night around 6:30 and we had made a reservation at 6 and the place was empty. We got great seating and pretty good food ( the fries are deliciously seasoned). My one complaint is how crumbly the burger was but that could've been my own fault for opting to not get the cheese (which was probably the glue that would hold it together). Besides the crumbly burger it was still good and our drinks were great! Loved the fun names. It definitely started to get crowded by the time we we left and if you wanna go to get food for dinner on a Friday night I would suggest calling ahead of time to reserve space.

Came here for the second time today.  It's a pretty big space so we were seated immediately around prime brunch time (1pm Saturday). I ordered a bloody mary which was just ok and my boyfriend got a mimosa.  For entrees, the hangover sandwich & a burger. My sandwich was BEC meets BLT + avocado, onion and a creamy chipotle sauce and it was amazing. My boyfriend also swears (for the second time) that this is the best burger he's ever eaten. He customized it with mushrooms, jalapeños and cheese and he was super happy with it.  I was happy to see that they had a sour beer option so I got the du claw strawberry sour which I enjoyed as well.  Overall another good experience and we will continue to return.

Fantastic portions found here at brunch! You don't normally get that in NYC, so a big big plus. Our server was so friendly and he was so much fun (he had an accent couldn't remember his name), and was a sport when we caught a bee and trapped it under an empty cup. I ordered the French toast and it was so delicious and rich! It definitely satisfied the sweet tooth, along with the mimosas.

Service was ok- we only ordered a side of fries which were good, although some of the girls didn't like the rosemary flavor, I didn't mind! Would like to try more food options and come back for brunch!

The food was on point from the perfectly cooked eggs, to the sauces and house-made sausage and bacon. I ordered the short rib and bone marrow benedict, my best friend ordered the cheddar grits with poached egg and chorizo. Both were so good! Service was just ok, as we were ignored trying to get drink refills, but we would definitely go back. You can also make a reservation on Open Table.

From the exceptional service to the perfectly developed food constructs this place is winning...which means my nutritionist is officially losing. I wish they had the fried green tomatoes available on the menu but that may be a seasonal thing. However they did have the various forms of stone ground grits and cheese options. And my friend had something that looked like the dream state of texas toast. Either way, it was all good and yummy. I recommend everything but the skillet cookie with milk, which registered as a bit bland to me and with slightly too much baking powder.

The patty was more on the dry side so I was hesitant to let my date try my burger because I didn't want his first experience with a veggie burger to suck. He tried it and wasn't so fond of it. He had the steak and eggs and enjoyed his meal a great deal. How were these grits? Better than my first experience with cheesy grits in NYC but still not comparable to southern cheesy grits. I'm not sure what the south does to their grits but those are something to crave for.

It was raining and I was hungry so I decided to pull up OpenTable and look for restaurants in the area. By the photos and the menu, I chose Boulton & Watt and I'm so glad that I did. We made a quick reservation and when we arrived, the Hostess greatly sat us at a table and we were SHOCKED to see how incredibly crowded it was in the middle of a Saturday. We ordered from the Brunch Menu and absolutely LOVED the food! The drinks were amazing the food was delicious! The decor is so cool and even the bathroom was unique! Although it was crowded, it wasn't an issue at all. I was even told by another customer that it's usually twice as crowded & I see why... I'll definitely be returning! :)

The food rolled out quickly which was nice made up for the wait time. Overall good spot gets crowded average age 25ish on brunch days. I like the senior citizen hours in this place. Relaxed sophisticated pub with amazing food and fabulous friendly service. Highly recommend the Bibb leaf salad and The Burger. Quick delivery of food to table but no rush to leave- one of those places be glad to hang out for hours. I'll come back here for sure.

The rosemary oil they use is to die for; the blue cheese was very good quality too, perfect texture and flavor. I ended up only being able to eat half the meal, so I took the rest home. Beau got his burger with bacon (it was the bacon cubes, not slices...meh, fancy decision but not sure it was the right one...and yes foodies, I know there's a proper name for the cubes, can't remember it now and opted not to google in the middle of my review)...and selected Brussels sprouts instead of fries (small up charge). The Brussels sprouts were some of the best I've EVER had. Perfectly crisp on the outside, yet still tender on the inside and bursting with flavor. I would come back just for these.

Boulton & Watt's desserts are SO GOOD (5/5). I've been to B&W ~15 times, and I'd say about 12 of those times were just for dessert.  The actual food is also pretty good- great burgers (4/5). The servers are great. The atmosphere is cute; very rustic. Only cons-the place reeks of beer (in the summer i prefer to sit outside), and is generally really, really loud (also why I prefer to sit outside). Overall, I can get over the smell and the noise for their rocking desserts!! Everyone needs to try the cookie skillet (gooey inside, crisp outside and comes with milk) ASAP.

Came here for an early NYE dinner with the family. I knew that I wanted the Quinoa & Kale salad and maybe the mac & cheese because the rest of the menu seemed too heavy for me. Wow!! Was I wrong. Everyone was so thrilled with all the dishes.  The cozy atmosphere and attentive service made the night extra special. We started with the mac & cheese, burrata, bone marrow toast, and brats in a blanket. I'm not a big meat eater but the brats in a blanket were absolutely delicious. We ordered the beef Wellington, squash spaghetti with eggplant meatballs, fish tacos, gnocchi, and of course the Quinoa & Kale salad. I wish we were hungrier; I wanted to try the butternut squash raviolis too.  Oh! And the hot apple cider hit the spot on a chilly night.  Thank you to the staff for a wonderful experience to help ring in the new year!

I'll be back for sure.. probably tomorrow.

Everyone who worked there was very helpful and kind, our bartender was Josh who truly rocked our night! This place will continue to be one of my favorite spots to go and I'll definitely recommend this place to more friends, the food, the drinks and the staff are all a 5/5, can't wait to come back again!

They were like orgasmic pillows of love that gently massage your palate while eating them. This place is a gem. It does get loud on the weekends, but it's the weekend so who cares. I'm all for gastropubs and high-end beer and bar food, but this place fell a bit short for me. The rustic decor is pretty cool, the total opposite of what was once Nice Guy Eddie's. There's 10 craft beers on draft and 8 bottle selections. Happy hour prices were solid, 5 bucks for my beer. Didn't try any cocktails but I've heard good things. As far as the food, the fried calamari was wayyy too salty for me. I had to drench it in lemon. I have low sodium eating habits, so that could just be me. The bibb lettuce salad was small and kind of sad looking considering the price. Same with the artichoke ravioli, it looked pretty but tasted okay. Overall, it was okay, a little pricey, but I enjoyed my beers. Maybe I'll come back for brunch.

However, when we were seated at the bar, we were instantly met with sarcasm and hostility from the bartender. He was incredibly rude and judgmental from the start, acting as if he didn't understand what we were doing there. Tasty food and very good service. If you are in the mood for low key bar food, this is the spot.

I've done both my birthday brunch and my boyfriend's birthday brunch here and everyone had a fantastic time both times! The food is great, drinks are good, and every single staff member is friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is also really nice with an industrial vibe inside. It was lively but not so loud that it interfered with us talking at our table. They also were so flexible with reservations and didn't require us to put down a credit card or deposit for a large reservation like most other restaurants do. I can't wait to go back!

Either a) this place cuts their liquor, or b) they don't bother rinsing out the chlorine from their liquor glasses. Ordered my standby, straight. Tasted off. When i pointed it out to the waitstaff, they said no chance, charged me for the full amount, and brought me a new glass of similarly crappy. Go somewhere where they don't rip you off.

3.5 - we came on a slightly busy but not jammed packed Friday night in the rain. The hostess was a little overwhelmed but we weren't sure why as there weren't any people waiting. They ended up helping us making two spots at the bar to eat because we didn't want a table. The bartender was great even though he was busy. Food was really good slightly higher then typical bar dinner. Fish tacos were tasting but tuna was a little over cooked. I probably won't come back for dinner as the burger and tacos weren't that good but I'll give it another try for brunch.
No comment

What a treasure, the food was just delicious. The waitress was a little difficult to hear for the specials, but the food and experience were so good it barely mattered. We went on a double date and it was just the spot. I would love to go back.

B&W is a cool place to meet up with friends after work or to grab some drinks as the cocktails are well made and moderately priced. The downside here is that the entries are just ok and though the servers are all nice, it seems like the place may be understaffed as it takes a while for you to get service.

great burger, also the veggie burger is amazing, loved it.
No comment

Cool vibe, Indifferent to bordering on rude hostess and servers, food was pretty good. We had the fried calamari and it was without a doubt the best I've ever had. Served immediately to us, piping hot (one thing I'll say is they don't let the food sit around cooling off before they bring it to you) and delicious. I had the blackened brick chicken with the mashed potatoes/Brussels sprouts, a delicious comforting plate. Which I needed because the staff was so chilly and the noise in the place was so bad I literally felt like I was dining alone. Any attempt at conversation was impossible, so I recommend trying to get seating directly next to your companion as opposed to across from. I might go back again as the food was pretty good, but I'll steer clear of the witchy hostess stand and seat myself at a bar table. The rating is based on 4 stars for food and vibe,1 for service.
Food is amazing here! Have come for brunch and dinner and both times it hasn't disappointed. The Mexican revolver is the best cocktail on the menu!

It has it all. Brunch is delish in nice quietish surroundings, NEW YEAR's WAS LOUD AND FUN and everything you'd hope a party could be. The staff has ESP when a glass was empty she was there. I know working a holiday can suck, I've done plenty and certain amounts of yuck in a person can be expected but wow the staff was ON and energetic and smiling THANK YOU for the pro and fun attitude. The food is always good and I am thankful for that when we want a nice treat out, its a TREAT! Can't wait for green tomatoes to come back in season LOL :)

Mac N Cheese. Order it and prepare for heaven. The best mac n cheese I've had in the city. Most of their dishes are amazing with a few that are just mehh. When the breakfast wrap is available (a limited special) you must order it! They have delicious sangria and a tasty drink menu. It's a nice open space, perfect for a Sunday brunch. Plus they have several different pickle back shots to choose from!
No comment

Sometimes in the endless, rough sea of Manhattan douchery you find a place of solace. A small island with a warm fire and a place to rest. The old fashioneds I had at Boulton & Watt were that very place. Clientele on a Saturday is your typical bros-n-hos-night-out but their eats and drinks are top notch if you need to hang somewhere "nice" in the LES but without the pretention of a lounge.

Love the ambience in boult and watt! I'm from the west coast and this place has a great laid back and rustic vibe. The food is amazing! Highly recommend the quinoa kale salad and the veggie burger! This place has the best veggie burger I have ever had. I always take my out of town visitors here!
Chill spot for some late night drinks! You can also get some beer of your own to pour out for your table which is nice. They also have a ton of pickles for the pickle lovers out there.
No comment
Not what I was expecting on a Saturday night - way too crowded and it took a long time to get an expensive drink.  I'd rather go down the block to a divey spot with fun bartenders any day.

This place has a really great, late-night vibe. The snacks are a bit pricey but everything was delicious. We started off with the fresh, homemade guacamole and their specialty salad of the day. The salad had a ton of flavor and I was very impressed!

5 Stars for the Blackened Brick Amish Free Range Chicken! I normally never order chicken when I dine, but the food Gods inspired me to choose this dish and i'm so happy I did. I cannot describe how flavorful this chicken was. Paired with the potato with brussel sprouts and bacon, this meal was a dream.
Quite possibly my new favorite Happy Hour place in the city. Perfect cocktails $8 between 5-7pm and really good fries. The quinoa salad-I would definitely eat that again and again. Yum!

When I first stepped into this place I just knew there was gonna be pickles and handle-bar mustaches. The steampunk ceiling fans were my tip-off. I was wrong about the mustaches but so right about the pickles. They have a whole section of the menu dedicated to it; pickled green beans, brussle sprouts, cauliflower, peaches, pineapples and pickled awesome. The rest of the food? So far so so good. Some of the best eggs benedict ever. They put the eggs on brioche, the hollandaise sauce was great, the pork sausage patty was delicious. I've also had the burger here and it was one of the better burgers I've had in NYC. When it gets busy though the quality of service gets tricky. Maybe understaffed this one time or an overwhelmed server. I would definitely recommend this place but it gets crowded.
Its definitely a fancier place price wise and the staff are great. Everything is good quality. We went by on a quieter Sunday night and got served immediately with prompt food.

When you're looking to get away from the VERY early 20's crowd that can sometimes be the East Village, Boulton and Watt is a good alternative. Whether you want to grab a bite to eat before your night out, or stop for a drink, it's a solid place. It's very bar / restaurant, with tables on the outskirts and a decently sized bar area. The food is pretty darn good - my friend got a beef burger last night and I got the veggie. I'm always hesitant with the veggie - I've had very good and very very bad, but this falls into the good category. It's topped with tzatziki sauce which is CLUTCH. The fries are to die for. Perfectly seasoned and crunchy. Does B&W play great music? No, but the food and age appropriate (at least for me) crowd, are a plus especially in this city.

Good food, great beer selection and decor, but it is way TOO LOUD.  Everyone is yelling to hear themselves over the loud music. I've been here a few times because it's close by, but every time I come home with ringing ears and a sore throat.  I don't even know why they blast the music - it's not a night club and people aren't dancing.

This is one of my new favorite neighborhood hangouts.  It's a very industrial themed gastropub with what looks like an amazing menu (I have not yet eaten there) and incredible drinks.  My personal favorite is the Lady Ashley (applejack brandy, lemon, honey, egg white, ginger beer) which seems mild until you've sucked down a couple and it hits you.  The egg white foamness with the sparkle of the ginger beer and the sweetness of the brandy make you feel like you are drinking alcoholic apple juice (yes please!).  Highly recommend this place.
No comment

Food was fabulous. Atmosphere was enthusiastic and fun. Great for a big group. Very accommodating.
Terrific food, great cocktails and awesome atmosphere! Jason and his staff could not have been friendlier and more accommodating. If you're anywhere near Avenue A you have to hit Boulton & Watt.
No comment

Went for a snack drink before a show at Mercury Lounge.  The food was overall great and so was the service.  Great happy hour specials on drinks and food.  I love the pickles.  I love the Brussels sprouts but found the mango pickle to be very vinegary... the mussels and the pigs in blanket were great and heavy in a good way.
Great and busy place.  Had a beer waiting for a friend. Nice selections of draft beers. Great staff. Later we ate burger which was so good. We where here on a sunday.
Brussels sprouts and  Mac n cheese were so good! And menu offers a good selection of mixed drinks. I'm a fan!
Good drinks. Mac & cheese was delicious as well.

Really good service and vibe to this place. We got a table outside, so was a bit more chill / quite than inside (minus the street traffic of course). The server was really great and the Mahi Mahi tacos I had were great!
Absolutely loved their guacamole! Perfect place for happy hour in the area. Rose recommended!

Food never fails: asparagus with egg, fried egg and arugula-- oh, so marvelous! Tonight  the bass poached in a delightful corn fraiche with a cucumber cocktail. Decadent desserts, neighborly service, and a gigantic bartender. Lovely.
No comment

I have now had the quinoa vegetable salad the last two times I have been.  It is amazingly delicious. This is coming from someone who typically orders mac and cheese and burgers and fries and other fatty goodness.  It was seriously delicious and I dream about it sometimes.

While I am still mourning the loss of Nice Guy Eddie's and missing their chicken, my dad and I gave this place a shot and although we were prepared to hate it and rail against it, we liked it well enough. My dad was able to get a beer that was over 10% (that always makes him happy) and I got a good enough sangria. The food smelled good but we didn't eat. I'd actually come back to try the food.

Pretty design.  Lots of exposed brick and comfy bar stools. The Irish bartender had it going on with good cocktails.  Over cooking the calamari costs them a star, and the pickled cauliflower was a real small serving for the high prices.

It was crowded on Saturday night, but we got a great seat by the windows. The fried green tomatoes appetizer is amazing. I could have ordered four and had it as an entree. I had the incredible veggie burger, ended up taking half of it to-go, and enjoyed it just as much for lunch the next day. The service was attentive but not obtrusive. Also our waiter was kind enough to pack up the leftover bones from my friend's lamb dish -- it was a weird request, but my cats certainly appreciated it.

Great place all around but hands down my favorite spot for brunch! Awesome menu selection and brunch cocktails are only $5 and served until 4pm. Love the atmosphere here- especially with all the big open windows. Definitely a go-to spot.
On vacation from Indiana and stopped in for lunch. Best meal we've had in Manhattan. Atmosphere is great, staff is helpful and funny, music is good, and food is phenomenal.

The drinks aren't out of this world and kind of over priced. The place tries to hard to look olden and kitschy but it just looks/feels very artificial. I came on a Sunday night and it was very easy to get a table.  The food was pretty good, not your standard greasy bar food (I enjoyed the quinoa salad with kale butternut squash and pomegranate). To me I equate this place to spitzers corner, a rustic looking place which is primarily a bar but has food. I just prefer the atmosphere, crowd, food, and beer section better at spitzers. Sorry.
Great new addition to an abismal corner.  Chef David is amazing and the food is great - amazing mac-n-cheese, the various "pickles" are deelish, and the ambience is cool yet not too cool for school.

Solid all around. Enjoyed the space and atmosphere. Really warm and welcoming. Great location in Alphabet City. Well done!!
No comment

I have been wanting to try this place but am never in the area. So, when I saw they were offering lunch via uber eats I made sure to partake. Unfortunately, the salad they had advertised was completely different than the salad I received. The chicken tasted like it was cooked last week and left on the counter, uncovered, lacking any kind of char. I had to search for the lettuce/kale in my salad. No pomegranate seeds, no golden beets- that's pretty much the majority of the "salad".  After reading the description on their website, I found out there was also supposed to be mint in it. Honestly, I am thrilled that I did not make the trip to the restaurant! Saved me an evening of hangry.

I highly recommend Boulton & Watt.  The restaurant is beautiful - large windows with a beautiful view, exposed brick walls, and unique decor - and has a great vibe. More importantly, the food is delicious.

Of course most yelpers would give this 4-5 stars because it's new and a novelty esp. for the bridge and tunnelers. But having been around, nothing esp. about this place. Giving it a conservative three stars since my experience there does not evoke a 1-star or 2-stars. Friendly service, ok food and drinks, just a bit trying too hard on being original in the cocktail side. Very loud esp, after around 10pm. Try not to be here, or anywhere in the neighborhood, on a weekend night, since it's mostly bridge and tunnelers and tourists, and loud, unless that's your crowd. Better established bars in the Lower East Side, a few blocks away. I'd like to see the reviews here 2-3 years from now, if they're still around.

This is a great bar with exceptional food and cocktails.  The ambiance and design of the restaurant is also really nice. I would highly recommend the fried oysters, kale dip, rubiola, and the short rib and bone marrow toast.  For dessert their mini cheesecakes are amazing!!!!

I have been privileged enough to eat this amazing new place not 1 but 2x. On the corner of Avenue A and Houston it's industrial revolution themed bar/restaurant really gives the neighborhood a new vibe. The staff is super friendly and very knowledgeable on the menu and the mixologoy of drinks. The Mexican Revolver by far is my favorite drink there followed by the MAC and Cheese ( a must have!) . They have a great assortment of pickled asparagus, radishes and pineapple. To die for! Definitely check it out.. Also a great to watch sports as the TVs come out of the hidden panels behind the wall. Love!
Good burger and really liked cubed bacon chunks and rosemary fries! Casual bar atmosphere, attentive staff, nice in the summertime when they have all the windows open.
No comment

Great for large, loud parties who want to drink and get bar food.  Definitely not a romantic/date night spot. Sitting indoors is so loud you can't hear your date.  Sitting outdoors is not much better due to busy intersection. Avoid, unless you enjoy drinking and yelling at each other. Food was nothing special and quite random, actually.

This place would go from 3 to 5 stars immediately if they took out the TVs. They need to decide if they want to be a cool gastropub or just a sports bar. Can't have it both ways. There are lots of sports bars in Midtown. But they've spent a lot on a really nice interior and location here in the East Village so I hope they make the right choice. Meantime, it fills up with the kind of people who go to bars to watch TV.
Lunch was great! Eggplant sandwich with rosemary fries  wonderful choice. Service was just as lovely. Highly recommend.

Great food but bad service.  Slow unfriendly waitress and cranky manager (can't remember name started with R?) . My friend's eggs came out wrong, she explained, the waitress took them back, then the manager came out. I thought he'd apologize but he actually made her feel worse like she'd ordered the wrong thing! My friend was specific and not on the least bit a pain.  She just doesn't like undercooked eggs. They came out fine second time, but we were pretty upset at the reaction.  Other than that, food good and interesting variety.

We found this place by luck the last day we were in NYC. The service was perfect and our meals were awesome. I took a special meal with house made pork, spinach and poched eggs, it was crazy in my mouth! :))
No comment

I live very close to Boulton & Watt and have been wanting to check it out ever since it opened, but FINALLY made it in this past Friday night. The place was pretty crowded by the time my friend and I arrived, but we were sat immediately even though we just wanted a drink. We met the owner Jamie who was an awesome, friendly guy. Cocktails were delicious and so was the skillet chocolate chip cookie!! Great addition to the neighborhood. I will definitely be back.
No comment

First time in New York! Super friendly and the food was even better! Must stop if your ever in town. Thanks Ryan for your hospitality and superb services! I highly recommend this welcoming and friendly restaurant/bar. Thank you...
The fact that you need a reservation at times is a bit ridiculous considering theres open tables at all times, but the food drinks and service was Absolutely great for the price you pay
Went here for brunch with a big group. Food was a mixed bag for our group but the ambience, service and $5 brunch cocktails were standouts for sure. Definitely a great place to come with a group.

This was a restaurant chose based on the location and positive reviews.  It was a Saturday night and we had a 9:30pm dinner reservation.  The place was beyond packed and very loud.  We ordered drinks from the bar before we were sat and it felt very crowded.  We asked the bartender for recommendations off their drink menu, but he wasn't helpful in the least.  He made every drink sound terrible.  I ordered the Mezcal cocktail and he was right...I did not like it.  It was really smokey and strange.  I don't like returning drinks, so I suffered through it.  Once we were at our table, we ordered a mix of appetizers and entrees.  I had the quinoa dish with chicken and I was really happy with my choice.  It was delicious.  I don't remember what everyone else got, but overall everyone seemed satisfied.  My main complaint is the place is so noisy that it was hard to make conversation.  I enjoyed dinner but wouldn't go out of my way to return.

Had a great time as a group of 9 on a Saturday night, with an 8pm reservation. highlights were the free range chicken and fish tacos - i had the salmon which was good but couldve used some flavor. Drinks were great too - go for the franklin my dear, trust the serpent and the mexican revolver.

A new favorite. Had my first visit to Boulton & Watt tonight and I will definitely be back. Great cocktails, great food, great service, great music. The pickled dishes were terrific and so were the specials. Loved the decor -- the wall finishes, the windows, the lighting, the fans running on interconnected straps. Looking forward to football season there as well -- the screens for watching sports were well integrated and not obtrusive.

On our flight from LA to NYC, we read the recommendation in the Food and Drink section of the American Way magazine of the Waimea Bay drink and pickles. So after we got off the plane, we went straight to Boulton and Watt in East Village in the lazy mid-afternoon and order two drinks, three jars of pickles ($2 each during happy hour), calamari, and fish tacos. We were pleasantly surprised with both the pina colada-like drink and the snack and food.  The place is uniquely decorated and the service was excellent.  After the waitress found out we are out-of-towners, she spent 15-20 min with us recommending various places to visit.  We thoroughly enjoyed the food and conversation and came out refreshed and energized with a fond first impression of New York.

Good stuff. Had 8:30 reservation here Friday. Got there 8:45 and place was loud and packed. Very loud. Cool spot but def not an intimate place. Had a drink at the bar, they have some good cocktails. Waited a while for table, I think they forgot about us because he seemed surprised when I went to see what the status was. But they seated us shortly after and had the waitress bring us over a complimentary bottle of prosecco for the wait, which was very unexpected. I had chicken under a brick which was great and she had the pot pie which was very good too. Very young crowd and not a fancy place but I'd go back.

Was a little busy for a weekday night, but still got drinks in a timely fashion and food. I had wine, although a short list, had good options and all the cocktails sounded very good. The atmosphere is nice, but was very loud mostly because of people. Seems like the hip spot to grab a drink with friends and catch up. I had the blackened chicken for dinner and that was the showstopper! It's a little pricey for chix  $20, but all the prices are midlevel around there, so seems like a good deal for upscale casual NY restaurant and the portion was huge. It was THE BEST chicken I've ever had in my life. The skin was blackened with spices, not Cajun not sure what, but was perfectly crisp and seasoned, while inside was perfectly cooked through, the chicken was piping hot the whole time that's how I knew it was fresh and cooked right. It all came on top of mashed potatoes with Brussel sprouts and bacon and a jus gravy sauce that was perfect. The menu is small but everything sounded super good. The bartender was very hospitable amidst being busy making drinks. Will definitely come back to try more!

This place might become one of my new go to brunch spots! The food was excellent! Friendly wait staff and plenty of seating. Great for big groups or just for two. The macaroni and cheese was was SO good! Any of the Benedicts are also recommended!

I have never encountered a bar with a more rude staff. A man, I assumed to be a manager, needed the table my friends were sitting at because it was reserved. Ok fine - however when my friend asked if there was another table available, the manager responds by saying, "No. Every table in this place is reserved. We take reservations just like every other restaurant in this city." Not only was this rude, he said it with an attitude and that's not even a correct statement. I've been to plenty of bars and restaurants that don't take reservations. When asking the hostess, who was dressed in sweatpants, how long a wait would be for a table, she responds, "do you see this list (pointing to her iPad) all these people are in front of you. So it would be at least an hour." Once again, another rude response from a staff member. Maybe they were stressed, maybe an off day, but I have no desire to return.

I tend to walk past this area of town later at night amongst all the lower east side debauchery so I've often walked right past this spot. I came here after work on a Thursday to find it calmer than I would expect but still a decent crowd. Most people were huddled around the bar area so we were able to find seats pretty easily. The beers on tap were phenomenal. Some of the best selection I've seen in that area of the city. The service was pretty good given how much the servers probably had to duck around the crowd up front. I got the steak frites which were so-so but my friends seemed to like the burgers they got. Overall good standard gastropub atmosphere perfect for afterwork and game nights I'd assume.
Good place to watch a sporting event, fun gastropub, food was good as well.  The seating situation in this place is cool.  Chicken pot pie was awesome.  Also in a great location.

I really wanted to love this place. I have been on a cocktail kick lately. The Thursday that I was (a few weeks ago) there was fairly busy and a just loud enough to be fun.  The place certainly looks great.  Unfortunately all four of us had sort of mediocre cocktails.  One drink have a violet liquor in it and I mean TONS of violet. Somebody else had the exact same cocktail and it had much less violet flavor and was much better.  I will come back for the vibe, but I might stick to beer.
No comment

Too bad that some drink/food established forget that they open not only to make money, but to make patrons happy and bring them back. They could definitely learn hospitality from Boulton & Watt. Went there yesterday, Thursdays night. Place was busy but i still could find a place at the spacious bar. Bartender was very attentive and made great beer suggestions. When food arrived i was kinda disappointed. Octopus was chewy and when i asked a bartender if i can send it back, within 5 seconds i had owner/manager talking to me. They apologized and quickly substitute it for a great tuna tartare. Guys did a great job including the fact it was happening after kitchen closed and i really hate to be "THAT table". I work in a kitchen myself so i know how staff feel about last second orders. Also they were super generous and gave us a round of beers. It was a great "going out" experience, we left in a great mood and definitely will be back soon.

This place is undoubtedly the best bar in the city for great drinks backed by great service. No matter how busy, these guys take care to treat you right. Sit on the bar near the door for Frankie and Meemo....Great guys/ great bartenders/ great people. Can't stress that enough; Everything on the menu is phenomenal here.

Delicious food, crappy service. We were enjoying ourselves until our waitress kept taking away plates and ($12 drinks!!!) that weren't even finished. So annoying! We felt like we were completely rushed through our meal. Very disappointed.
Came here today for brunch.  Their mimosas were so weak and food was nothing to rave about.  Service was slow. Waited about an hour for our food.  I will not be back unfortunately.
No comment

There were seven of us for brunch on a Sunday at 12:30. Cool venue, alright food. I had the egg frittata and it was a little dry. The bloody mary may or may not have had alcohol. Felt a little rushed at the end even though we kept ordering tons of drinks after we finished eating. I probably won't go back.

Stopped by this cozy friendly spot with my daughter, who lives nearby, and sat at the bar. Fabulous chicken breast under brick!!! Crispy flavorful skin,moist chicken..served on delicious smashed potatoes with Brussel sprouts! Comfort food at its best!

We went here for drinks after having brunch elsewhere. It was later in the afternoon and the place was not at all packed, but the bar was full. We set our things at one of the common tables as we tried to make our way to the bar. The hostess was unnecessarily nasty about it not being the bar and that we couldn't sit there. We definitely did not stay and I have certainly changed my mind about trying their brunch, it's not worth it when the staff antagonizes their customers.

If service is king, this place is royalty.  We were just looking for a quick bite and the menu posted outside looked great.  We walked in and asked about the soup of the day and the person behind the host stand told us that they don't do soup for brunch but he could arrange it for us.  Great!  I am getting over a cold and just wanted some soup.  The same person came by our table as we were looking at the menu and offered more good advice and was extremely helpful and friendly.  When our waiter came by, we mentioned the soup and he said he'd have to ask but we pointed to the person who seated us and he said 'Oh, that's the owner!  If he says it's ok, then it's ok!'  My husband got the veggie burger.  Both were great.  The soup (potato leek) was creamy and tasty.  The veggie burger was so good that my husband informed me about how much he was enjoying it after every bite.  We also got fries.  Man... These fries are great.    Perfect.  I'll probably dream about them tonight.  The owner came by to make sure we were enjoying our food and was sure to tell us to come back.  In case I didn't convey how great the service was, just go and see for yourself.  What you'll also find is a creative menu, tasty food and a comfy atmosphere.

Great location. Sat right by the window. Came here for brunch and ordered the french toast with poached eggs. My french toast was a bit soggy but still yummy regardless. $5 mimosa and bloody mary specials with brunch. Seating could be a bit tight with the high tables. A large group sat right behind me and kept bumping into me when they were getting up. Overall, decent place. Will try it again sometime.

Came here with a group of 10 or so friends on a Friday night.  The food was great - I got the Blackened Brick Amish Free Range Chicken and shared the Kale and Artichoke Fondue.  Both were delicious.  We ordered several bottles of wine and the bill was still very reasonable.  I will be going back.

If you want to feel happy in a restaurant this is the place to be. I went there for the third time and once again left with a smile on my face. So far I have had the brick chicken, steak and more recently their hamburger and fries. Besides the food being absolutely delicious, each time I am surprised at how sophisticated the food detail is for such a casual fun place. I must add that this is not just a restaurant for the younger generation. Each time I go one of the chefs or owners stops by the table to see how everything is. They also have one of the best wait staffs in town. Save room for one of their delicious creative desserts. My favorites are the mini cones and their brownie sundae.My one comment would be that if you don't like rosemary like me request that they leave them off your french fries. They are crisp and delicious on their own and a great portion.
I was only there for a short time, had a couple of beers. I am writing this review to say that the guacamole is the best I've ever had!!! That's all.

Boulton and Watt has become my new go to.  I've been on a Friday night and during Sunday Brunch.  Both times the place was packed and lively. Great atmosphere although it can get a little loud.  Their guacamole is fantastic. Also, really loved their spaghetti squash with eggplant meatballs.  I would definitely suggest making a reservation.  Great neighborhood spot to go and just grab drinks any day of the week.

Tried out this new place for dinner a few days ago. Interesting atmosphere and delicious food. In hindsight I should have tried the burger without bleu cheese first to get the full flavor, but it was still good nonetheless. The drinks looked interesting, but I didn't get to try any this time around. My only complaint is that the stools at the high table area, while interesting, are extremely uncomfortable; my legs kept falling asleep as I sat there. I'd recommend sitting at a table or the bar instead. In any case I'll be back this week to see how round two goes.

Really 3.5 stars, but I'll round up.  This is a loud, crowded place right on Houston.  Gets more of a LES crowd than East Village.  The food was alright, the duck confit carbonara was good, but nothing to rush back to get again.  The chicken look pretty good, would get next time.  Beers are a little on the expensive side, but they have a great selection and in full pints.  Overall a good place if you're in the area.
No comment

One of my favorite NYC spots to eat! Great food all around, no matter what time of day. And of course the best drinks as well! OMG..... Had a great time at Frames NYC.... The people and music was great (Naomi the bartender)....

Came here for a burger and drinks with a friend...the fries were uneven. Half were crispy, the other half soggy with the right amount of seasoning on them. The burger was also pedestrian for the neighborhoods standards. The bun was a bit ....damp...if that is the correct word. Also the meat was prepared as asked however was devoid of any flavor really. Service at the bar was spotty with about 5 people there but the bartender only checking in on us after we stood up and started getting dressed to leave. Another minor caveat that I had was that my drink tab was less than the $10 credit card minimum which they didn't tell me until after my friend already paid. First, these minimums are technically illegal in NYC and secondly if there was such a minimum we should have been told that so we could have combined our tabs. Put a damper on the end of a night. This place has great date spot and group potential with a moderate atmosphere that says classy without being pretentious about it. It looks great but didn't think the food and service lived up to expectations. Would be willing to stop back and give it another try however.

As much as I would like to promote Boulton & Watt, I won't do it because of a poor experience that I had when it first opened. I have lived in the surrounding neighborhood for years and wanted to bring business to this establishment when it first opened. I used to run a happy hour once a week with a bunch of co-workers and friends. We work in the finance industry and are always happy to get out and spend a little bit to have a good time. We were also combining charity donations along with our drinking fun. I contacted the manager, Jaime, and explained that we were interested in hosting a happy hour at Boulton & Watt and wanted to know if they had any interest in contributing a small percentage of our final bill to a fundraiser that we were running for homeless youth in NYC. He was very enthusiastic and committed to it over email and then I stopped by the bar to introduce myself. I promoted the happy hour(s) and fundraiser to everyone and brought a rather large group that evening after work. We had a nice table in the corner near the window. The other people stood near the bar and we had a nice time ordering both food and drinks. People weren't shy to order more because they knew that a percentage was going to charity. Jaime and I had agreed to take a look at the final amount of the bill at the end of the night and he would donate a percentage based on the amount. At the end of the night, he was no where to be found and the bartender advised that he left for the night.  I emailed, called, and stopped in a few days later but he stayed out of sight and dodged my emails and calls. It was unprofessional and left me with a sour taste of the place. Since then, our firm has not done any happy hours or business with Boulton & Watt. We never ended up getting any type of small charity donation for our endeavor. I walk by it very often but will not stop in. It's unfortunate. Good drinks but don't count on them to stick to their word!

After having spent several hours there for a friend's birthday party, as well as running up a tab of over $70.00, I tried to take the empty growler that I had actually paid for already. As I exited, the bouncer literally grabbed my arm in a violent and forceful manner, and informed me that I needed a top for the growler. I tried to comply by going to the bartender for a top, and the bartender refused to provide a top. The manager then came over and referred to me using several expletives. They were clearly having an off night - our server was very sweet and very inexperienced - We explained exactly how we wanted a drink and when we got it it was awful - When we tried to explain it to her for the second time, she looked so confused I went to the bar myself to tell the bartender what we wanted - The bartender ended up also being the general manager - when the drink came back, it tasted exactly like the first one - that is because she brought the same drink back - we know this because the bartender was calling her from across the room saying that's the wrong drink - we ordered mac & cheese - it came out cold and she said that's the second time that has happened tonight - We asked to speak with the general manager and he brought out a hot mac & cheese - We ordered deviled eggs they never came - we ordered diet Cokes they took forever to come - We enjoyed the chicken pot pie very much but the chicken sliders were so chewy it was comical - Our first server stopped by to tell us she had to go to side work and someone will be taking over the table - We then got our second very sweet but very inexperienced server - Because we are apparently gluttons for punishment, we asked to see a dessert menu - she brought us drink menu and it took us forever to flag her down and ask for the correct menu - We shared an ice cream sundae, which was very good - The general manager came over and told us the one dessert was with their compliments, since they had all been suffering from "turkey brain".  We really didn't want anything for free - we just wanted a good meal - but if you are going to try to make up for that many mistakes, comping one dish of ice cream does not seem sufficient - In fairness it's a pretty room - in our neighborhood and we have had good food there before - we will probably give it another chance.

This place seems to be on point in an area where businesses come and go quickly. Their menu is amazing and I can't wait to try so many things. I had the wings and the prosciutto flatbread and they did not disappoint. Cocktail menu also looked great. Semi-unisex bathrooms were a plus as well. The atmosphere of the restaurant was really nice and the staff was great.

Went to White oak today for lunch sat at a window table, had a party of three people. Was greeted by a manager or host at the front door pretty sure it was a manager. Made a few simple jokes with her to break the ice and was seated. Server came over took the order. But she made no suggestions. Seemed very unenthusiastic to be there. Never came back to the table to refill any drinks. Did not ask how the food was. Manager stood in front of table over looking the dining room which wasn't many customers. Stood so close to the table but never turned around to ask can I get you a refill or how is the food. Saw her roll her eyes but not an ounce of service in this staff which was minimal. Two women and a buss boy and a food runner. Waitress never smiled, engaged in no conversation, basically took order and dropped check. Felt like for an 80.00 lunch the two ladies could care less if we were there. Will applaud the chef food was excellent but the front of the house needs some serious John Taffer improvement.

The service and food here are amazing. Blackened chicken sandwich is delicious. Great decor, tasty cocktails and a friendly bartender make this the perfect place to grab a drink after work or just lunch.

Nice bar near Union sq. They have a good selection of beer and reasonably priced cocktails. Drinks were good, we didn't try food tho, but the menu looks interesting and would like to come back and try their food.
The chicken pot pie is excellent. Great ambiance (themed as an old-fashioned study) and service. My girlfriend had the portobello burger which she enjoyed as well.
I love White Oak Tavern! Service is great always, and as well as the food. This place is a nice intimate cute space for a date, or a catch-up date with a homegirl over some wine :)

Excellent. I get the Brussel sprouts to start and the chicken pot pie almost every time.  They are both amazing!!   My husband prefers the burger and I'd say it's a solid choice for the pickier eater. The only problem is seating.  The no back stools make it difficult to enjoy your dinner but if you make a reservation you can usually get a regular table.
No comment

Looking for a date spot? Come here. Great atmosphere, music is played low so you can actually hear each other. Good drink selection and friendly staff. The food options are a cut above typical bar fare. The lighting is mood setting. An oasis in union square.
Great cozy atmosphere, right near NYU.  Brussels sprouts were AMAZING as was the wine.  Really nice bar!
Love this place - a little noisy but the brussel sprouts make up for the noise.

Even if you are not a huge fan of pubs like I am, you will love this one! We enjoyed great, friendly, attentive service...absolutely charming and memorable. Then, we had 3 delicious, expertly prepared cocktails and entrees that are typically 2-3x the price at pretentious places. My strip steak was astonishingly perfect! The sauce was amazing! The tahini cauliflower was nothing but scrumptious, as was the burger. And then to our amazement, they didn't even want to charge us for the steak because I asked for it to be sent back for a bit more cooking, which they did happily! Do not waste your time at pretentious, rip offs..I wish I could name places. You know them. Just come to the White Oak Tavern!
Great experience here! Good food, good service! My hubby had an issue with his food, and they quickly took care of it. Dessert menu looks amazing, but too full to indulge!

One of our absolute favorite places! Always hopping of a Friday night but not so overcrowded that the experience is lost. Food is amazing, drinks are delightful! Great selection of whiskeys. The staff are amazing especially Jules, Pete, and Johnny!

Only a block away from NYU Stern, White Oak is a second home for many students!!! I've dropped by before/after classes/meetings for drinks. There's always a good crowd- not so packed and loud that you can't hear your own voice or get a drink, but not a ghost town. They have your typical NY drinks on tap and some surprisingly yummy cocktails as well. I tried the Penicillin ($12.50) last night and really liked it. It's light, refreshing, and comes with a dried ginger candy.
Love this place! Great service, ambience, drinks, and food. Make sure you get the crispy caramelized Brussels sprouts and the alcoholic doughnuts!!
No comment
No comment
We stopped here based on yelp reviews  and they didn't disappoint!! We loved the beer, atmosphere and friendly service ! My son didn't like his food but we did ! Great chopped salad.

Nice place. Was interested to see if it had the feel of a british pub, having been in nyc for a whopping 2 months now! It was more than half empty but my husband and I were told by the young guy at the door we could only be seated at the bar or one of the high tables. Still he wasn't arsey about it so we sat at the bar. The whole time we were there no one else came in and even the girl who served us was surprised we hadn't been offered a table. This was a Sunday @1300, so maybe they were expecting an influx. Food was good. We both ordered mains, and wings to share. Wings were on the sweet side. My husband orders wings in most bars so he was a bit disappointed by that. Beer good. Bar itself has a nice vibe to it. Would def go back.

This place is fantastic. Had the grilled octopus, the coconut curry mussels, and the fried chicken sliders (all recommendations from our awesome bartender Ruth) and they were amazing. Some of the best food I've ever had. Ruth was super friendly and helpful. We will be returning!

I came here with a friend after a campus visit for NYU. I love the dim lighting around the dining room and the uplighting on the bar. The restaurant has a classy but not stuffy look. I ordered a draft beer, mussels, and fries. The mussels were small but acceptable for the price and the number mussels in an order. The sauce was absolutely amazing. It was a bit of a tangy, buttery, curry taste. I even dipped my fries in it! The service was friendly and timely.

So my previous review was 3 stars for being charged for ice tea refills.  Decided to go back as it was close by. I mentioned the tea fiasco to the barmaid and she says no we don't charge for tea refills, so we ordered tea, grilled cheese and bacon, and salmon. All of the food was great (as mentioned in previous post).  Let's just say they took care us this time .  Will be back when in town, and maybe before I leave.

Not convinced. I often have to go there because it is close to work and people find it easy to just cross the street. Our place to go used to be Apple but closed down. Drinks at Whiteoak are ok, nothing remarkable. I am a tequila and mezcal drinker and was not impressed by the selection. I have not eaten there but the food does not wow me, and wouldn't eat there anyway because of the ambience. The place cant decide whether it is a pub or a restaurant.

I stopped in here on a whim after reading about the burgers.  (It's close to my office.)  When I asked the bartender, she said that they could be a life-altering experience.  I was sold.  Let me tell you something: they are.  There was something magical about the combination of the bacon and that mustard that I don't think I can really describe.  What I will say is that you should try it.  Then again, you should check this bar out for no other reason than the "whiskey bible" which is kind of awesome in itself.
A nicely decorated space with good food and decent service. It gets busy Friday nights. The fish and chips are delicious.
We had dinner Saturday night. Cool room. Crazy good whiskey cocktails. We ate a bunch of apps and each one was tasted. Our server was Chloe and she excellent.

This place isn't bad just your average "New American" pub. It is well priced for what you get and its got a nice atmosphere during dinner time, yet during lunch it's basically empty. I would come back, but try a few other places in the big apple first.

Made a reservation, went there and was told by someone the computer said you have 36 minutes before a table is ready but your on top of the list. I asked when we would be seated. The person was not capable of answering the question.
We had chicken pot, pork belly, steak and pasta. All very good. I will recommend pork belly and chicken pot. The server is very nice, always with smiles.

Saw this place as we were walking around in the village. We saw they had oysters and being from the gulf coast we had to check it out. This is a very neat and classy establishment with very good oysters. A must visit if you are in the area.

We love this place. Service is usually excellent. Food is delicious. My favorite is the deviled eggs. The bar bites are real  food not cheap frozen apps deep fried that a lot of places serve. Did I mention half price bottles of wine on Sunday's? Good place. Check it out. We walked by 100 times before venturing inside. Glad we did...

The reasons for the 2 stars:  I ordered baby back ribs, cheese and mac, deviled eggs and peach bourbon.  The ribs weren't cooked as much as they could've been.  I think my order was about 5-6 pieces of them.  They were tough to me. Not very tasty except for the bbq sauce; the cheese and mac was devoid of cheese.  The sauce tasted more like a mixture of water and flour.  No cheese taste at all. The only things I really enjoyed was the deviled eggs and the Peach Bourbon.  Those two things were simply delicious!  The restaurant was great in that it was clean, they played great music I sang along to.  It reminded me of an old English Pub.  The ambiance of the restaurant was very pleasant, lighting and everything--even where the loos (washroom/water closest) are, very English! Great place for me to go for a drink or two. If I could give a separate rating on the restaurant itself, I'd give it five stars.  The food, mediocre at best.

Great menu and excellent food, my sister had the chicken sandwich and I had the pulled pork, which was  to die for! Staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is a welcome refuge from the hustle and bustle of lower Manhattan.

Great service at the bar! Came in for happy hour (they have it on weekends, too!) and the deals are pretty good. Half priced wine bottles - their Pinot noir was good! Got a lot of the bar bites and they were all ok, but our favorite were the fries! Got the donuts for dessert and it was ok - good for sharing. Laid back ambience.
Nice atmosphere great place to eat. Staff is friendly.  Would definitely recommend this place when in NYC.  was referred by a friend. Good choice.

Randomly happened upon this place for lunch - I had the chicken sandwich.  Now - I like chicken and expected the predictable, trusty sandwich from just about anywhere.  NOT HERE!  This baby had me at one bite!  I couldn't stop eating to talk.  My bosses had to take a back seat and wait until I was done for me to answer their questions.  I didn't care - it was THAT good.  They were jealous I didn't let them try it.  Sorry - too good to share!

We tried it based on Yelp reviews and weren't disappointed.  It is a cozy tavern near NYU.  My son and I both had the chicken pot pie which was great (if you like pot pie).  My husband had bangers and mash and my nephew had a Grain salad.  There was something for everyone.  Nadia was our server who was great and attentive.  The place was busy, the ambiance was comfortable and the food was good.

Great atmosphere, lots of candles and soft lighting, including in the restroom. Cozy, nicely designed and decorated. Food was delicious. We ordered fish and chips and the chopped salad with grilled chicken. Lemonade was perfectly tart, and they brought chilled water to the table as soon as we were seated--very welcoming on a hot, humid evening.
Great drinks, food & atmosphere. Peter & Colton at the bar made sure to take care of us and see that all of our ketchup & cocktail-related needs were met! 5 stars for sure.
No comment

What a great find! Stumbled across this place while in the neighborhood thanks to Yelp. Really great atmosphere, excellent food and reasonably priced. I would certainly recommend this spot to anyone in the area, and definitely plan to go back myself. I had a delicious burger, and some great appetizers as well (brussel sprouts and a squash dish I believe). Really great spot to grab some drinks and dinner.
Well crafted cocktails with excellent service and delicious food.  What more could one want.?
Fried chicken sandwich was amazingly moist with the perfect balance of light crunch, fresh bun, and sweet, tangy slaw.

The location and ambience of this place is great. The craft cocktails are amazing. The appetizers especially the popcorn are great. The game changer for myself was the duck flatbread..... Who would have thought it! Excellent staff who are very friendly and helpful.

I hadn't ever heard of White Oak but to my surprise my cousin and I had one of the most phenomenal cheeseburgers of our lives. They also have a pretty unique list of beers to chose from. Definitely a place I'll be coming back to.
Ambience is great. Service is a bit slow but friendly, and good selection on the menu.

a beautiful bar. aesthetically i'd give it five stars.  and the fact that they have kentucky bourbon barrel ale on tap is a big bonus.  just don't order any mixed drink that's not one of their specialty drinks, because the bartender that served me doesn't seem to know what goes into a whiskey sour.  i knew i should have changed my order when after i asked him if they put raw egg white into their sours and he said "sure.  how many eggs would you like?"

4 stars for a nice atmosphere, good service from a very friendly staff, and overall a great experience...but the 5th star is for the best chicken pot pie I've ever had in my life.  I'm actually kind of shocked how uncommonly delicious it was. Nice job folks, will definitely return.

This review is for brunch which was excellent. The place is very spacious and can accommodate big company, even with kids. Not loud, very classy looking. And their brunch menu is very extensive, for any taste. We had all different egg dishes and were very satisfied. My Eggs Benecdit were in very interesting presentation and so tasteful. I will definitely come back there.
No comment

Met a few friends here after work the day before New Year's Eve which is why it was probably a little on the quieter side. The cocktails were amazing, The Natural was my absolute favorite! Great ambiance, bar snacks we got were great, too. Definitely a gem in the NYU area.

Great place, we stooped there for quick bites before Blueman show. The bartender was very professional but friendly. The drinks and food came out quick. Awesome Brussels as our bartender suggested and Ribs appetizer are so yummy. Definitely recommend !

A very nice spot for Sunday brunch. Wasn't crazy busy, but the food was good and service professional. Charming in an old-timey pub way, but not corny at all. I had the pulled pork hash, which has a bit of a kick to it.

Extremely friendly staff willing to explain any of the craft beer or any questions about in general about the drink menu. Came in pretty late so we weren't expecting anything - but the bartender was great.. even if it was nearing the end of her shift!

Went there last night after Caroling in Washington Square Park.  The place was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  We ended up sitting at the bar for dinner since it was a bit crowded.   Overall a great night.
No comment

Tasty cocktails, friendly staff, expectedly bougie eats. We were a party of seven and we didn't get a table until about an hour after I arrived (although some of the folks in my party were running REAL late so it didn't matter much). We enjoyed ourselves, it was a lowkey place to meet friends and would be great for a date too.

I stopped in White Oak Tavern after a concert at le poisson rouge. My friends and I didn't order any food but got cocktails. The drinks were reasonably priced and the bartender was entertaining. This is a nice addition to the neighborhood.
Beautiful ambiance! Cozy and romantic. Only had drinks, so don't know what the food is like. But would love to try it sometime.

This is a really great (fairly) new spot in the NYU vicinity for casual dining and drinks in a very cool old-world atmosphere. I've come here several times since starting at NYU, and have always been pleased with my meals here. It's one of those great local places that I was glad to see open up in the area. The interior is beautifully decorated- dark, but in an antique and charming sort of way. The bar itself is also beautifully set up. Totally love the ambience here, and I would say that the food does it justice. I've had several things here from salads to burgers to waffles at brunch, and have never been disappointed with the food. Everything is very tasty. I recommend the chopped salad, fried Brussels sprouts with bacon (delicious!) and pretty much any of their burgers. The food is great, and it's just a really nice place to hang out and have a good time. Definitely recommend.
Nice, old school but refined interior and good selection of beer. Knowledgeable waitress.

Food, drinks, Irish accent. Check-check-check. Great bar in the area that feels more geared towards the young professionals in the area, not the college kiddos. I love supporting White Oak Tavern because they are great people, and local.

This is a great bar that also has top notch food. It's an oasis of adult classiness in NYU-land--but it's also a perfect date place for the aspiring young student who wants to impress that special someone.
No comment

Damn good beer selection. Good happy hour specials, good food. Great place to go. Near NYU, close to the 9th street oath, convenient, but not overly crowded with wasted college students. Great vibe. The burger and smuttynose pumpkin beer are winners!

This place is pretty spacious and our bartender was awesome. I had the rose sangria which was nice 'n sweet (love my drinks with st germain in 'em!). Great spot to check out that's right across from NYU!

Great neighborhood bar/restaurant! Feels like a British pub and has a solid selection of whiskeys and beers to back that up. Surprisingly good brunch is worth checking out. Lots of plugs under the counter to keep your phone charged. Helpful and friendly staff!

Stopped in to treat my daughter and her friends to a early dinner.  Great beer choices (cold).  Had a great meal.  Great music.  Around 5pm (Sunday) two guys started playing very cool soft rock tunes.   We will be back
Happy Hour on Saturday. Very nice. A really tastie crock of onion soup to warm up on after walking.

I am giving this place four stars just because this is the third restaurant in that location that I've seen in 10 years, and it is the first I've been compelled to enter. That block is such a no man's land that this alone is a feat. But they actually aren't bad as a pub, either. I had a pot pie of some sort and a beer and some Brussels sprouts. They were all competently prepared, and service was attentive and professional. All in all, I hope they keep it up, because I cannot handle another Murphy and Gonzalez-type abomination.

The white oak tavern Is a new addition to this vibrant area.  That being said I think it supersedes any other spot around.  The food is on point, there's not one thing on the menu that can be ranked above or below any other as the standards are high across the board.  the beer selection wide varied and freezing.  But the staff are attentive without intruding and warm.  Over all amazing
No comment

This quaint pub has a lovely ambiance and great food. Our foursome ordered 3 bacon cheeseburgers that were cooked perfectly and the flavor was outstanding! The chipotle mayo was an amazing addition to the burger. The BLT was delicious and the fries were terrific. A trip to the restroom was an adventure. While not handicapped accessible the bathrooms were so cool and reminiscent of a speakeasy. The entire place was beautifully decorated and the staff warm and friendly. The entrees were reasonably priced and we will definitely return.
We stopped in for a quick drink Friday. Love love loved the bar and bartender. Great ambience, very chill atmosphere.
The food and drinks were awesome. The brussel sprouts appetizer was delicious. The rose sangria was great. The service was wonderful. Highly recommend.
No comment
The best hamburger cooked to perfection and worth every penny. Very attentive service too. Def coming back next time I'm in nyc.

Arias like Darius without the D is the bomb. By far the nicest bartender I have had the pleasure of meeting in nyc. Will purely come back just for banter with her. Arias is an asset to your establishment!

We visited this place on Easter for brunch. The decor was beautiful and homey and the Brunch was delicious though the drinks seemed prepared by an amateur.. We love this area as it is slightly off the beat and track and a quieter place around NYU. We asked for the salted caramel sundae as a sweet end to our meal. They were out of the said ice cream, but they brought out a delicious sundae of vanilla ice cream with caramel and chocolate sauce. It was yummy. We decided to return for Mother's day and try dinner, well what a disappointment. I ordered the flat bread pizza. For 13.00 I got a 5x3 flat bread with sauce and a dribble of buratta, here and there. I mean, where was the cheese? My family found their meal ok. We ordered the Salted Caramel ice cream sundae again and that was completely different. A schmear of an icing like chocolate around the middle of the bowl, the ice cream plopped in the center and a sprinkle of popcorn on top. That was no Sundae. Sorry to say, we will not be returning. Their food and preparation should match the care they took into the decor of this place. Such a disappointment.
Super cozy inside, really friendly staff, and just an all around cool place to hang out and get some drinks.

I actually enjoyed this place a lot more than I expected. We came here for a quick meal before a Rangers game. I loved the vibe of the place it had a very welcoming staff and feel. Ordered chicken sliders (loved!) mac and cheese, ribs-delish! Brussels sprouts And bangers n mash. I'm not a bangers n mash fan but my bf was pretty happy with it. Of all things the mac and cheese was the biggest disappointment. It was extremely bland. Also the Brussels sprouts were super good BUT also drowning in whatever oil was in the sauce. Overall it was a decent meal and what we were looking for at the time. I'd give it another shot in the future.

Dimly lit. If you can get there before about 6:30pm you'll miss the happy hour rush. Well if you're looking to mid it that is. I enjoyed a prosciutto truffle, cause I can't pass up either ever, and it was tasty! Enjoyed a solo quick bite. Service was a little slow it took my server/bartender a few minutes to come by to get my order. (I was surprised since there were a few people including myself sitting right at the bar accessible but maybe too early) I would go again!

On Monday evening, 7/22, between 7 and 8:30 p.m., on a VERY rainy night, my umbrella was lifted by someone leaving the White Oak Tavern. It is a unique umbrella: Sage green background, pink flowers scattered about (like Old English wallpaper) with a curved, blond wood handle. Thing is, I'm 86 years old and need to use a rollator-walker, and that was the ONLY umbrella I can use--long enough to hold while allowing me to grasp the walker; a curved handle making it easier to hold onto walker. IF YOU'RE THE ONE WHO TOOK IT, PLEASE RETURN IT TO THE WHITE OAK. No questions asked. This was no accident. Yes, it was raining, but if you needed an umbrella there was a selection of ORDINARY ones there. This one is special; I got it in London 15 years ago, and it's the ONLY umbrella I can use now. Oh yeah, I'm a regular at the White Oak, so obviously I like the food, the ambiance & all. Until tonight, that is. Don't like the thieving clientele.
Wonderful food- burger melted in my mouth!  Fries were perfect. Atmosphere was lovely.  Julia, our sever, was beyond helpful and kind!  Can't wait to go back!

We had dinner at the White Oak Tavern Saturday night and really enjoyed it.  The restaurant is like being in an English pub, the wood bar and woodwork is beautiful.  The menu has a lot of good choices, we went with the burgers and they were delicious!  All of the staff were really nice & helpful.  Our server was Andrea who was great!

Great environment (super clean and cozy), great food (had the spicy margarita with fish and chips , awesome beer selection (too many to list)  and fantastic service (very attentive but not annoying).  What more could you ask for?
Relaxed atmosphere, mellow jazz, good drinks, and a hilarious/attentive bartender.  What more can you ask for in a bar after a long Wednesday?

We only ate here to escape the rain but we stumbled into a great restaurant!  We had the French toast, mac and cheese, salad and the grilled cheese.  Everyone was happy with their meal!  Plus- the service was great.
Good happy hour drinks. Nice appetizers. Try the grilled peppers. A little overpriced for the quality. Good place to know about. Nothing special given the neighborhood.
No comment

NYU buildings loom in the border of this, "Hey, are we in Jekyll and Hyde, because it's really dark in here" kinda place. The food was not remarkable, but it was decent.  My husband and I had salads, burgers, and some drinks.  I ordered the "ancient grain" salad and it was not overly generous with the tasty ingredients (avocado, almonds...) but the tamari dressing was "I think I would try to duplicate this at home" good.  The Burgers were alright, not enough toppings or enough meat, in my opinion, and served on a wooden plank in an effort to make everything look bigger.  We were initially seated at a dinner table, but after waiting over fifteen minutes for someone to take a drink order we got up and ate dinner at the bar.  I don't think I would bother going back here.  The laissez faire attitude of the staff and what we received for the price do not justify a second visit-- NYC has better offerings.

Waiter was really nice but i was very unhappy with my food. We ordered muffins and they never came. Also my main course took forever to come out, was served cold, and had extra ingredients that weren't on the menu that I actually can't eat. Sent it back right away of course. I then ordered Mac n cheese which was way more spicy than promised, so I couldn't eat that either due to my stomach problems.

Closest thing to a cosy North London pub that we've found in NYC. Not a "studenty" place, despite the location so close to Washington Square Park. Good selection of drinks, and everything we've tried so far from the well put together food menu has been great.

I went there with some family visiting from Scotland. The pub had a great atmosphere with all the wood decor and candlelight. We all ordered various dishes and you know the food is good when everyone is stating, "You have to try this." Excellent staff that are very knowledgeable about the food and beer selections. Great place!
No comment
Authentic and cozy place. Have a walk in the park and relax with good food,  cold drinks and a very friendly staff.

Extraordinary service, reasonable prices and really good happy hour drinks are the big three attractions of this NYUberhood gastropub. Add to that free and awesome wifi and - this is a big plus in NYC - totally private toilets! All around terrific experience on a consistent basis. A rave fave!

Came in with a few friends as it was our first visit. We loved it.  The food was delicious, service friendly and great drinks.  A triple play for us straight down the line.  Looking forward to our next dinner here.  It's a must try for all.

I came here recently with some friends and can only speak to the drinks, but the cocktails were tasty and the drink menu had solid selection range. It wasn't too crowded or loud here, either, which was nice.
No comment

Had previously only been here for drinks, but tried dinner this week after catching a matinee performance at the nearby Public Theatre. Everything we ordered was fantastic! I highly recommend the Chicken Pot Pie and an order of the Brussel Sprouts!

Stumbled upon this place with a girlfriend of mine, we're very picky and had been wandering the streets looking for a nice dinner spot. I was instantly attracted by the ambiance, perfect place for a date. Reasonably priced, great service and the fooood! I've been twice now and their pies are phenomenal, also tried their burger and that was a palette pleaser! I'll be going again and again and again!

Great location a block from Washington sq park. Decor around Xmas time was very nice. $8 happy hour cocktails were reasonable, and a wide variety of drinks to choose from. Highly recommend the Brussel sprouts, delicious sauce. Grilled cheese with jalapeños was also good. This yelper come back.

Great spot for delicious food in a cool yet cozy venue. Service attentive and plenty of eye candy! Good wines by the glass from someone who is very picky about wine... Doughnuts are to die for!!! Hubby signed up to their whiskey program which is quite quirky - always interesting to see what fun new things the New York restaurant/bar scene comes up with!
No comment

So... Two Marine Corps combat vets walk into a bar.... The white one gets the attention and gets to order while the Asian one gets an completely ignored and has to order through the white Marine. Amazing in this day and age this sort of behavior still exists but I guess the management saw fit to hire these two racist morons. Unfortunate. Was simply too tired to give a shit that night but will speak with the management if this sort of horsefuckery happens again.
I was really impressed with the cozy setting, the phenomenal food and the great service.  The ambiance is really quite delightful and comfortable.  Excellent all around!

Stopped in for brunch with a group.  Food and service were top notch. Lots of great choices on the menu and our server Jonathan kept the drinks flowing and was always there if we needed him. Highest recommendation.

Ordered delivery. The salmon was perfectly cooked - so tender and buttery in texture. Also ordered fettuccine and beet salad which were also great. Food arrived quickly and I was overall very impressed.

Great spot! My boyfriend and I had made a dinner reservation here and since they were running a bit behind schedule due to lingering parties, they offered us each a drink on the house. Cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious food (love that it's all local, too); will definitely return the next time I'm in the area.

Amazing KBBQ. They cook for you at your table. Cute themed atmosphere. I got the skirt steak it was amazing! Service is super efficient. This is my second time at this location and I will definitely come back! They don't do reservations for parties unless it's 6+ Fri-Sun btw!
