Well where do I start... my friend who was with me has been disappointed at other Korean restaurants in the neighborhood and was really looking for authentic delicious Korean food... We hit the jackpot here... She ordered Kimchi stew and was so very pleased!!! I enjoyed the marinated Kalbi and my other friend ordered seafood noodles ... The service was wonderful we ate outside... And the food was absolutely delicious the portions were incredibly good... And I would highly recommend

Pretty good, no rice wraps or romaine to wrap your bbq. But I guess for NY it is acceptable. The staff was nice and the selection was good, just not enough bang for your buck.  A bit over priced for normal KBBQ with not enough to choose from.  I'd try a different place before returning.

I've been here many times and suggested it to my sisters to come for dinner.  We came around 445pm but it was already chaotic there.  We ordered the kalbi and pork for dinner.   Just note there isn't a lot of food so be prepared to order at least 3 servings or more.  I felt somewhat rushed to finish my dinner since there was a line out the door.  Service was ok.  The waitress who attended to us initially wasn't the friendliest but the server who cooked our meat was nice and attentive.

One of the best KBBQ I've ever had. I got the marinated beef platter which consisted of marinated galbi, marinated salchi cut and marinated thin beef skirt. All 3 cuts were perfectly marinated, not too sweet and tender. The beef cuts were of quality. Tofu soup, egg soup or whatever and side dishes were not and as well. Definitely will return.

Came here for my friends birthday and I LOVED IT!! Food was so amazing! I felt so full I loved it so much and can't stop thinking of the food!! Pricing was decent!

Very good service, still trying the menu but looks good, especially for a cold winter's night...

Amazing I love it here. Such a great spot. Staff went above and beyond for us on Sunday. Thanks guys!!!

The food was great, service was great, and ambiance was great- lively lots of people enjoying themselves. The bar has good music too! My only complaint is the price and size of portions. I come from flushing- I'm used to more all you can eat type bbq which allows for more variety. All and all great experiences drinks were amazing!

I don't want to offend anyone, their food is fine, but I don't understand why you brought the bill and put it in our eyes while I was eating my food. this was so inappropriate. it's very inappropriate. there is no reason for that either. We've been to a Korean restaurant before, but I haven't come across anything like this. We felt compelled to get up.

Came with 4 people. Got a small beef platter with spicy pork, post stickers, glass noodles and a soup to all share! Was amazing flavor and with some drinks came to about $50 per person which considering we had more than enough food I'd say is worth it without a doubt. Really happy we came will definitely be back
Best Korean BBQ in the city. Fantastic quality and such a fun atmosphere. The service is always impeccable and I take anyone who is visiting me here.
A little pricey but definitely worth it! Meat was super flavorful and service was GREAT. Also did not smell like kbbq after which was a plus.
What can I say. Jongro always hits the spot and is my go to Ktown spot.

The food here is amazing and fresh. The staff is very nice, accommodating and polite. Highly recommended if you are looking for a fun place to dine out with friends .

Unimpressed.   For a street full of bbq restaurants, I decided to give a 3rd chance to Jongro.   The Flushing Jongro disappointed twice, the Manhattan must still be good... I hoped.  I've been to the Manhattan Jongro a few times before the pandemic and I was hoping it to be somewhat decent.   For a table of three, the only banchan (side dishes) given was 1 macaroni salad and 1 kimchi.   We had the $50 LA kalbi and it was literally 3 pieces.   The pork belly was good.  The japjae was ok.  The seafood pajeon was good.   For $150, the price is okay for lunch.   But it just didn't seem like we had a proper bbq without any side dishes.   We were thinking of trying Love Korean bbq or Antoya.   Wish we did.  That's it.  After 3 disappointing tries with Jongro, we are moving on.

Wow, it's like a food speakeasy: walk up to some sort of office building vestibule, check in and then take an elevator to a wonderful restaurant with high quality meats

Omg this is what I've been waiting for. Jongro is one of the best kbbq spots I've been to in nyc. They have the secret recipe. The meat here is quality and you can taste it. Yes, it is one of the more expensive options in Ktown but it is surely worth it. We decided to get the pork belly as well as the marinated kalbi(not pictured- ate it before I remembered) and the glass noodle dish. Everything was amazing and the banchan that comes with the meal perfectly complements. I will be back soon.

Enjoyed the service and the Korean BBQ was excellent. The service was great and they were very attentive to cook all the food properly in front of you.

This was the first KBBQ place I came to in NYC with some friends! We met up on a summer evening and it was pretty easy to get a seat. It was pretty crowded, but the wait wasn't too long. We went with the beef platter and the pork platter for a table of 4. Compared with AYCE, this was really quality meat and you could definitely tell the difference. I would say 2 platters was about enough to fill a group of 4, not to the brim, but AYCE vs more premium kbbq cuts are just a different experience. The best was probably the kalbi on the beef platter. With a few bottles of soju, the meat, and a couple of sides, and it came out to about $50-60pp. Would defs come back on another day when I'm not thinking about all my student debt :)

Hidden on the upper floor of a building this restaurant serves up some pretty tasty food. We ordered the Green Tea Cold Noodles Dish, Regular Seafood Pancake, and the Galbi & Cold Noodle Combo. The cold noodles were really refreshing because the broth was perfectly cold and not sour. I also really liked the crunch and flavor of the pickled cucumbers and radishes in this dish. The Galbi, on the other hand, was well seasoned. The seafood pancake was the star of the meal. The pancake was crispy and delicious when paired with the sauce. The seafood inside wasn't overcooked and the pancake was filling. Overall, the food was good. I recommend you get the pancake if you go there.

First, the meat was good. I also got the spicy cold noodles which went very well with the meat. The service was attentive. But the only reason I gave it the rating of four stars is because of the price. Sadly they do not do AYCE, but man the price for the amount of food we got was way too overpriced. And the lettuce salad mix was bland - wish there was more flavor but I'm guessing it's just a sesame oil blend. Wish there were more affordable options.

Staff were friendly & helpful. I enjoyed them cooking the food for us. James was attentive to our needs. He was also entertaining. Thank you for the awesome experience!!!! James... we are Warriors fans!
Favorite KBBQ place in NYC. On the busiest nights be prepared for a 1-2 hour wait. Food is incredible and service is awesome despite it always being so busy. Loud but fun atmosphere.

Jongro BBQ delivers quite satisfactory Korean BBQ. We got an order of the pork belly and the bulgogi - which was plenty for 2 people. The banchan was limited compared to other restaurant but of good quality and more than satisfactory. I was surprised that we didn't get a basket of lettuce but instead two types of salads - which actually worked to complement the meat. The steamed egg dish was also quite good - steamed at the table and not too salty. The pork belly was excellent. The bulgogi was cooked with some broth, noodles and vegetables - which I wasn't expecting but actually was great on a rainy evening. We ordered a side of rice. The service was quick and efficient, and we didn't have to wait long - albeit it was a weekday late evening.

Some of the best Korean BBQ in NYC. Super fast and friendly service. The food is incredibly delicious. Go with friends!

I have been coming here since I was little, and it seriously never disappoints. This is my favorite KBBQ spot in NYC. There's no fuss, it's very affordable, & it's consistently delicious. 3 of us got the beef platter, which had a variety of cuts of meat that were all cooked to perfection by our friendly waitress. We also got the pork short rib, which were marinated and incredibly flavorful. All the sides provided are fresh & delicious. The steamed egg is my favorite, don't be shy to try it if you haven't before! Also, I highly recommend trying their Yuzu Spiked Seltzer, I will be searching everywhere to find it in stores! You must try the legendary Jongro BBQ! It's a dining experience you can't go wrong with.

Coming from Boston, Jongro's really makes me wish I lived in New York instead. At first I was a little nervous since it didn't seem like they took reservations but luckily they were able to accommodate us right away. Without having to wait to be seated and immediately being able to order the meats it was such a good experience. They cook everything for you which is amazing - you don't have to be afraid of your one friend who somehow manages to burn everything they cook. Juicy, tender, with your own preference of seasoning there is absolutely nothing to dislike about the meat selection at Jongro BBQ. Even the soondubu they provide on the side wasn't overwhelmingly spicy but still held good kimchi and veggie flavor - wish they gave more than just one bowl :') . The only downside is even with vents to pull the air you still end up leaving with your clothes smelling heavily of bbq meat, so definitely not the place to wear your fanciest attire. Would love to come back soon because the beef selection and pork belly were just SO good.

If you want amazing KBBQ, Jongro is where it's at!!!!! Jongro is literally my boyfriend and I favorite restaurant in all of NYC! We have tried majority of the famous KBBQ in nyc including the michelin KBBQ but to be honest Jongro just can not be beat!!!! It's absolutely delicious. Our favorite is the USDA Marinated Kalbi. But we usually get the platters. We come here pretty much once or twice every month! We can't help it. We come here so often we notice changes in the menu. They recently did a price hike which sucks but understandable because of inflation. We still come and pay for it so clearly it's worth it. We love our platter but also love the lychee cocktail and the mango beer bomb. What is annoying is that when we bring our underage siblings here, since they are not 21 no one on the table can have a drink. But like they were not going to drink any way? Just the adults? But still no alcohol allowed. Really weird and annoying. But whatever we come here for the food and not the alcohol. I love love love the macaroni and the egg too. The spicy rice cake is great but a little spicy for me. The side dishes are so delicious too with the meats. We literally bring all our friends who come visit NYC here and they are NEVER disappointed. Like ever. And neither are we! We come to jongro to be happy whether because we have a celebration or we're having a bad day and need some cheering up. Jongro is the best way for Diego and I to get happy. Our friends are so sick of seeing my instagram story of Jongro because we are here literally every month!! Been to jongro probably almost 20 times in less than 2 years!! We need a stamp card because we absolutely love this place. I'm telling you it's the best. If the line is long that's okay just walk around ktown get a boba and a corn dog and then eat at jongro after. That's our usual routine! We also love the Gopchang in the 5th floor. My boyfriend is Colombian and he lovesssss it too!! Gopchang is def a different more adventurous kbbq but man jongro does it so well. The 2nd floor is definitely the original and the best to try. Writing this makes me want to eat jongro again!!!!
Amazing atmosphere & incredible food! Such a fun place to go out on a date or with friends. Highly recommend!

Great quality of meat and all the sides were delicious. The servers were very attentive and made sure our meat was perfectly cooked. Great ambience as well!
Cousins took me and my husband here when we visited New York. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. As California natives, this place did not disappoint. We'll definitely be back!

Decided to go here instead of an all you can eat KBBQ spot and enjoyed my experience. For a date I ordered the $90 beef platter, comes with ribeye, brisket, kalbi, skirt steak. It's a good choice for 2 people, it's the perfect amount of food and we were both very full without over eating. The service was good and they serve the usual Korean appetizers prior to the main course. Solid choice for a non-AYCE KBBQ spot in Ktown.

What an amazing meal! Everything was delicious. Service was great. Not cheap- try to use someone's expense account for this meal!

Came here for KBBQ and ordered the beef combination platter with the premium cuts. All of the cuts were so yummy i didn't even have to use the condiments! The star for me was the tofu soup- it tasted so phenomenal! Its been my second time here and it has yet to let me down!
Absolutely the worst Korean food in ktown. Watered down and diluted flavor. terrible staff.  An embarrassment to real Korean food.

Did KBBQ here in their outdoor area two times! It's fully covered with fans in the summer and was still pretty comfortable with heaters the last time I went in November. The food was great and good for anyone looking for a KBBQ experience but are relatively new, as they come around and turn the meat for you.

Great food! We had the pork platter, as well as chicken. The chicken was well marinated, and the pork was cooked very well. Macaroni salad was a plus but slightly bummed there was no cheese corn.   Pricing was not too terrible, around 30$ per person (we had a group of 5). Service was great, would definitely come back again!
Been here about twice. Got their bbq once and lunch special the other time. The food's good and the staff are nice. Overall a good kbbq place

Great spot for KBBQ and right in the heart of Ktown!  We went to the one on the 5th floor. It was a little confusing to find but worth the hunt! Grab some grub and then hit up the Korean skincare shops!

Was a very typical kbbq experience for me. The quality of the meat was undoubtably superior to your local all you can eat kbbq but lacked a little flavor wise. The marinated galbi was very mild and defeated the purpose of getting the marinated version. The prime ribeye was a bit tough and not worth it imo. The downside is when the staff cooks it for you, some of them do not know when to flip and when to cut. Our meat ended up being a bit more overcooked than we liked. Also they don't provide the steamed egg as a free side dish which is one if the most exciting parts of going to kbbq and getting that as soon as youre seated. Overall fun experience as a one time thing.

Holy moly, this is the best KBBQ I've ever had. I was so excited to try this place because I've heard so many good things and I finally understand the hype. My friends and I ordered beef platter and I got the Lychee Soju Cocktail. I highly recommend getting the cocktail, it was very refreshing and paired really well with meat! This is a must visit place for me if I'm ever in NYC again!

I stumbled upon this Korean barbecue restaurant and I'm so glad because now it's one of my favorite restaurants to go to Korean barbecue food. Even though the restaurant does not have many options on their menu it's pretty basic do you get different meats but the amount of food you get is crazy. The margaritas are really big and so good I highly recommend coming here if you wanna have a lot of food and get buzzed.

I highly enjoy Jongro. It is an excellent location for quality Korean BBQ. Usually this place is bustling but last time I went the social distancing protocols made it seem so surreal. This is definitely a popular spot for quality kbbq. Do keep in mind if you're used to cheap KBBQ (like the 2 hour all you can eat places), this may seem expensive. But it is delicious and I would recommend checking it out. They have curated platters or you can order a la carte.

Had a great Sunday lunch with a friend. We picked two cuts of beef and the seafood pancake and left more than full. The service was attentive and we had our banchan and sauces refilled when empty. I didn't leave smelling too much of meat so the ventilation was pretty good. I will definitely be back!

It was good! Esp the pork belly and beef. Unfortunately they don't have the dipping sauce like Kang ho dong or extra jalapeno, cheese corn or steam egg. So I still prefer Kang ho dong
It's a fun place with loud music. The food was delicious. Everything we ordered was good. If anything thing I prefer whole lettuce leaves to wrap the meat with.

Came here with my husband for his birthday. It was one of the best meals of our marriage! Highly recommend! So good!
Solid Kbbq if you can get a reservation! Great banchan and kalbi, though their lychee cocktail was a bit too sweet for my liking, overall would recommend!

Great and incredibly popular k-bbq place in K-town. We put our name on the list and took a walk around before our table was ready. The meat here is definitely delicious, although a little on the pricy end. The service is absolutely amazing - the servers will cook it for you perfectly. As always, try to come with a larger group of people so you can truly experience k-bbq! We also ordered cold, green tea noodles for after the meat which I would highly recommend. The green tea really cools you down after eating so much meat.

Third time here in a year. Absolutely phenomenal food and service. I had the marinated tenderloin tonight, but I've previously had the sirloin and the short rib. All delicious cuts of beef. Rice is now $2 per side,which is absolutely fine. Very fresh and tasty veggies and sauces. Pleasant staff. Will be back soon!
Classic Korean BBQ just like what I ate outside USA. Jongro has really great service though it is a little bit too dark inside.

A bit pricey but well worth the quality of food and experience! Good kbbq is hard to come by and this place hit the spot 10/10!

Took an elevator to upstairs. The bbq was good and authentic except for Macaroni and cheese. Would prefer kimchi to m&c. We asked for rice and received 2 small bowls of rice and got charged for $4. Rice was always included in other Korean bbq places we went to. Checked vaccine cards. Accept credit card. Pricey.

A friend and I went for dinner on a Friday night, we were told the wait was 30-45 min and oh boy was it worth it! The marinated Kalbi was so tasty. Great atmosphere (even though I found the music to be a touch too loud). We also got the glass noodles and really enjoyed them
Really good. they cook the food for you. kinda expensive though but they give a lot of food.

One of my favorite Korean bbq spots in ktown. They have a tent set up with a huge heater making it tolerable in the cold and they have music so it's a nice mood. The marinated kalbi is my favorite but expensive ($40.99). The meat is always tender and soft. The staff is also very attentive. Overall recommend!

Went as a group of 6 after reading the reviews. We were between this or Let's Meat, an AYCE starting about $40 before tax and tip. We got the large beef set, rice cake and pork belly. Quality was soooo good and we basically inhaled everything

A must in K town!! So so so good! Came here for lunch with a small group - fantastic experience. Several lunch specials to choose from, and a solid menu offering a wide variety of dishes. Ordered kimchi pancakes, spicy cold noodles, beef bulgogi, tofu stew...the list goes on. Absolutely delicious and flavorful and loved every part of the meal. Such a cute atmosphere too. Kind of hidden so definitely make the effort to go! Service was great too!!

Worst restaurant in ktown. They rushed us out even after order $200 plus more for bbq. I specifically told them NOT to put in ramen noodles IN THE BUDDAEJJIGAE (army stew) bc the noodle soaks up all the broth. And of course they make my bbudaejjigae WITH NOODLE INSIDE THE BROTH. Look how little the meat is and rest is just noodle. This place is OVERPRICED. WORST SERVICE restaurant in ktown. Aka. Im korean and lived in nyc more than 15 years. This is far one of the worst. No wonder koreans don't go here and they just rip people off with ppor quality service and food. I CALLED RESTAURANT AND IT GOES STRAIGHT INTO VOICE MESSAGE. CANT EVEN REACH OUT FOR REFUND. Ridiculous.

The quality of the meat at JongRo BBQ is good. We ordered the Beef Platter which came with Prime Ribeye, Thin Sliced Brisket, Kalbi and Skirt. Also included in the set was the Spicy Tofu Stew which was just the right amount of spicy and comforting especially for a cold day. As customary with Korean BBQ, a variety of banchan side dishes were included. The service was very good and attentive, helping us flip and turn the grilling meats and asking for refills of banchan items as needed. Overall a very good experience.

This place is one of my favorite Korean bbq places to go to! I normally get the seafood pancake, seafood soondubu and a beef platter (small or large size) with my friends to share. The quality and quantity of meat is amazing for the price! The line is normally really long on Friday and Saturday nights so make sure to get there early, but what I love is you can put down ur name and number and they'll call you when your table is ready.
Not impressed... the food was average, the tables were dated, felt rushed and way too expensive for what you get.   The only positive is the place is big and you are not on top of other guests.

First time for me trying Korean BBQ but went with my son who has been to a few in k-town...everything was explained about how to order and what everything was once it arrived at the table. Delicious and a great experience.

Came at 6PM on a Friday night and there was no wait. They have outdoor dining available but we sat inside on the second floor. The beef tartar was delicious.  The marinated platter was delicious. The servers cook all the meat for you. You may feel rushed at the end because they clean your table and give you the check right after you are done eating.

I have never ever had such an awesome interactive experience at a restaurant!  I sat back and let our host order so all I can tell you is that we ordered beef, chicken and pork!  The experience started while we walked through a crowded street with all of the outdoor COVID dining of other restaurants. We took an elevator up to a non-crowded, beautiful restaurant that had plenty of space between tables. The employees were very helpful in making suggestions when we ordered and as we were taking the food off of the grill.  The whole experience is that they literally cook everything right at your table - no really, they literally cook everything at your table! (We all wanted our meat cooked to different temperatures and they met that need.). Make reservations and go here!

Cutesy greenhouse setup for outdoor dining to put you in a good mood to start off with first. The staff were friendly. Food AMAZING. The marinated kalbi dipped in bean paste had the perfect taste pairing. The dumpling rice cake with short rib noodle soup tasted light at first but as you dig deeper, the flavor presented itself. I guess the soup base sunk so make sure you stir it real good. Overall, super impressed. NYC KBBQ does not disappoint.

Not the Best but the not worst. More of the average Korean Barbecue spot in New York KTown. The food was pretty good and the quality of meat is decent as well. Wasn't all too big of a fan of the Kimchi soup, but liked just about everything else. Service wasn't bad, was average. Price wasn't all too too bad either for the service and food that you get.

Excellent service not to mention quality beef . We have tried different bbq places in the area and hands down this is the best place. The beef intestines was outstanding and of course, beef and pork were oh so tender! Love this place !

Quality meats and ingredients are fresh. The staff is nice and friendly. The menu from outdoor and indoor dining are slightly different. You will only be served if your party is here and temperature checks are required. I've tried their beef platter and their seafood pancake. Both really good and flavorful. We also got the grapefruit and peach soju (my favorite). Definitely a place to treat yourself once in a while.

This place was all right. From pictures, the food looked good, but in reality, it was mediocre. The portion was really small for the price and the galbi was really salty and dry. I thought the green tea cold noodles was going to be amazing but it was basic and nothing really special. Other places that sell this combination does it much better.

Great service and fun atmosphere, i felt like i was in Seoul Korea in 2000. All the hot kpop songs were playing last night. I was happy to hear and almost danced while i was having galbi!

Come here for kbbq often and it has not let me down yet. You must get the beef tartare. It is raw beef served chilled with an egg yolk mixed in. The description may sound odd for some but you will not regret it if you try it. The service is good and they will cook the meats for you on the grill if you need help. The prices are bit steep but the meat is quality. They don't have lettuce for you to make wraps which is a disappointment. Otherwise this is my go to kbbq when I am in the area.

wait is about an hour long on a Saturday evening which is fine but the service itself does not live up to the hype. Menu was difficult to understand and definitely on the pricey side. Staff was not communicative leaving my group of 5 confused on what to do next. The music in the place was very loud, not a place you should go if you're trying to catch up with a friend. There was a mix up with my food which was very upsetting and on top of that I found a hair in my food ! I was quite disgusted. Upon receiving the check and paying the waitress shooed us away with her hands which was very disrespectful. There are other ways to politely clear the table. They rush your experience. All in all I would not recommend.

The meat is amazingly tender and juicy, but it's too pricey for me. We have two of us and 215 dollars including tips. Especially for the alcohol, check the price before you order it.

Really good Korean bbq. The banchans are great too! Went with 5 people and spent about $50-60 each depending on rather or not you ordered drinks. The server was fast with the cooking process. I wish the lettuce was cut bigger though because it was too small to do a proper Korean wrap. I got the lychee soju cocktail and I finished it! Wish There was more soju in there though lol  would come again next time we are in NYC. Did felt rush though probably because there was a huge line behind us.

Jongro offers outdoor seating. The staff did an amazing job with covid guidelines. They had face masks and gloves on. There was a bottle of hand sanitizer for every table. I ordered the japchae. I wish it was a bit more chewy and soft though. The overall sweetness blended well with the beef and veggies. As for the Korean bbq, I've had better. THe meat was a bit bland. All the food was served in disposable containers. There is no grill for outdoor seating but the servers still bring out the food hot.

My husband and I ordered the $100 dollar meal, the meat was delicious especially the ribeye, I would definitely recommend the food but I knocked off two stars because the of the staff. The staff didn't explain how this dining experience was going to go. I had to ask if we cook the meat or if they did. The staff cooked the meat and were very attentive but I wish they would have explained what somethings were and how the process worked. Thankfully I had been to other Korean restaurants so I had a general idea of how things should go but their lack of explanation and how it felt like they were rushing made for an odd dining experience. My husband and I left feeling like we don't know if we enjoyed the meal like we should have, especially given our $150 check.

I (vegan) had the Impossible Vegan Bibimbap and it had cucumber, mushrooms, greens, Impossible meat, kimchi, and rice. It was tasty and flavorful, but spicy.

K town is a tourist trap now. Food has been downgrading while the prices are rising sky high. Jongro used to have good lunch with sweet rice desert as complimentary. But now the food is edible and labels the good quality it used to offer.
My friends and I had such a great time out there. We reserved seat. It packed even though it's during the week. Nice service and very amazing  meat! Go get it!!! Special meat combo is a great choice!

Safe to saw we grubbed! This was so good, super authentic! The meat was tender and juice, the pork dumplings were french kiss, and the lychee drink (alcohol drink) was soooo good! Recommend everyone to go here!!! Lowkey if I could leave more stars I would!!

Ordered a takeout. Flavor and food quality is okay. But I'm so surprised and disappointed by the portion. Over $14 for a really small bowl of naengmyeon.
I LOVE THIS PLACE. It's a vibe and the price is reasonable for the amount of bbq that my friend and I did.

Great experience here this past weekend. Popular and busy with an efficient queuing system. We had the pork belly and plain kalbi. The kalbi was marbled perfectly and the pork was thick. Meat was of great quality, service attentive, although ban chan was lacking. Will return the next time we are in NYC.
Quite a pretty pricey bill but also amazing Korean BBQ. Have to say this is among my top choices in the city (Manhattan). I honestly don't know where to start but expect a very filling dinner!

I decided to dine in here on my vacation to NYC. The wait was 45 mins on Saturday but I spent it at a few shop around the restaurant so it didn't feel long for me. The food were pretty good. I got 3 different kind of meat and a large size tofu soup. It was all delicious and we left the place full stomach. Very satisfied!

I absolutely love this place. The ambiance is fun and relaxed at the same time. You get out of the elevator and enter this amazing world of KBBQ. The food is delicious. Pricing is expensive but that's NY for ya
My all time favorite KBBQ in NYC! The service was A+++ and the food was always amazing. Servers are very attentive even during busy hours. Definitely a must go!

Waiting on the waitlist usually isn't that long when I go usually. Since I usually come here to eat by myself or a couple of friends. I always get the same order every time I come here and I am never disappointed about any of the food I get from here. Sometimes if the seating is packed I just choose to do take out and I usually only wait around 30-40 mins for my food which isn't so bad at all. It's all worth the wait for me. Excellent service.  Food was very good.  I have been to busan on business and bbq had similarities.  The ambience was very good for Saturday night.

I have to say as Korean myself of  past 43 years this is the worst experience I could ever expect from a Korean restaurant. I have always been  proud of being a Korean and our respectful culture, but this restaurant's service is making me embarrassed in front of my Persian friends. The person who greet us was very nice and brought us to a table of 4. I was excited introducing Korean food to my guests by order all variety of barbecue beef,pork, of course and Soju. When the kimchi came, my friend was trying to cut them with the scissor that was sitting on the table, then this young waiter walked over put the pork on the grill and start yelling at her "kimchi is already cut. don't touch the scissor, put it down now. This is for us to use!" We we're all shocked. Of course he didn't use the scissor at the time and just walk away. Totally unacceptable. Will never return again. Not paying this kind of money to be verbally abused. With all the Korean restaurants out there, I rather drive to queens. Really miss the old days when Sheila BBQ was around.

The food is good but for the amount we paid for it wasn't worth $270 for a serving of 1 serving of Pork belly, beef belly, chicken breast, beef stew with ramen and 5 soda.  It's a good experience as the ambiance and service was good, however, it's not something I would go back to.

Always a good time here. Not cray about side dishes as your typical KBBQ locations but def worth just for the meat. Personally I don't get marinated bc I think it defeats the flavor and quality of the meat. Also, a cold nitro beer is worth!!

I'll do 5 starts for this baby even though you have to take a shady elevator to get there. Great experience. Definitely go for the BBQ -- we had shrimp and were quite satisfied. Kimchi pancake is also highly recommended. Staff feels rushed but they have to attend to a lot of tables and flip their meat.

LEGIIIIIIIT!!! So glad I picked this one and suffered the wait! I've been to KBBQ all over NYC and LA and this is now one of my all time favorites. Meat is the highest quality and furthermore, our waiter went above and beyond cooking it perfectly for us. The atmosphere is great, the decor is fun, and the window views are a nice benefit. If you're looking at all the KBBQ in the area and not sure what to try, pick this one!

We got the ribeye, pork belly, and tteokbokki which was enough to fill us up. The ribeye itself was such good quality that we could eat it without dipping at times and it was flavorful. The pork belly was like any other - just good ol' fat.

One of my more stoic friends delivered one of the most passionate pleas to get korean BBQ from this particular place that I've ever heard. And I def understand why after having been here a few times lol

Solid spot for KBBQ, nothing too special or bad, everything is as you'd expect. Depending on how much you eat, you can easily drop 100+ here, which is typical now of KBBQ in NYC, so think of it as closer to a steak dinner than a casual dinner price wise.

Love love this kbbq spot. From the waiting area beer to the old school style of the establishment to the perfectly cooked and flavorful meat. The banchan is a bit lacking but overall an amazing place for Korean bbq with a group of friends.

Friends have endlessly raved about this place, so I braved the crowds to try it out. After long lines, I finally had the chance to try it for myself. The meat is really just mediocre at best, slapped together with some bean sauce and lettuce leaves that they give you. Each meat order was about $30-45 and it came out to about $100 for just 2 people. There was no banchan or special sides. Just salad and overcooked steamed eggs. There was really nothing special about this place and I've been so many, many Korean restaurants having grown up in NYC. I hate to say negative things and this place is popular enough to withstand my comments, but it's a hard pass for me.

This is a great KBBQ place in Koreatown. The galbi, ddukbokki, and kimchi pancake are DELICIOUS and you should definitely get them. Compared to those heavy hitters, the brisket and bulgogi taste more mild and didn't get as much love from us. They still taste good though! The brisket is delicate and the bulgogi came with lots of soup and glass noodles. Their outdoor seating goes into the street so there's lots of fresh air and space. We had a great time feasting here outside.

The outdoor set up wasn't too bad except the 2 people tables are sooo small...can barely fit anything on the table so request a bigger table if you're planning to order a lot of food. It's def not the same experience as actually grilling the meat by yourself at a table and they cook the korean bbq inside. the food was alright to be quite honest. i've had better korean bbq and this was super mediocre. the marinated kalbi was delicious though! the side dishes weren't that appetizing and i noticed other people around us didn't like their side dishes either. this is the closest thing to korean bbq until they allow indoor dining again. the service was nice - the waiters were friendly, helpful, and fast!

This review is probably NOT going to be helpful at all since my friends did all the ordering as they're locals. Regardless I can speak from my experience! They have indoor and outdoor seating it looks like. I put my name down on the waitlist for 4 on a Thursday night, and it was about a 30-45min wait so we grabbed a drink at Itaewon Pocha next door. They texted us when our table was ready, and in we went, up the elevators to their main floor. Wow, this was NOT like the KBBQ joints I'm used to in the Bay Area/Socal. Where I am used to Gen KBBQ-like places, where it resembles a posh nightclub.... clean and modern, flashy lights, def like a fancy hotel lobby or something.. this place had more of a traditional feel. No flashy lights in sight. Def change of pace for me but I loved it. Music, similar to Gen was still upbeat and pumping. We were seated and my friend got straight to ordering. I had some sort of soju cocktail (I think, I can't actually remember..), and my friends had some beers. In came the meat. We got 3 dishes. I think 2 beef and 1 pork, like I said this may not be helpful since I did not order lol, HOWEVER, what I loved, and I know this sounds dumb, was that the servers came over and cooked the meat for us. At Gen and the like, I'm usually the one slaving over the hot grill, cooking and cutting the meat for everyone. Can you tell I'm a mom? The meat was so tender and juicy..... Sides were delicious. The real showstopper though was the Kimchi Pancake... best I've ever had in my life. It was perfectly crispy and the flavor was just.. delicious...... Def have to come back!!

I overall felt it was okay and I probably would like it more were it not for the fact that NYC is filled with kbbq restaurants. Meat quality and cooking service were both fine but there frankly wasn't anything that actually distinguished it from all of the other restaurants along the street. Yes, it tastes better than the average AYCE joint but it's also not a particularly inexpensive option for kbbq here. What really makes the restaurant for you is probably the vibe and atmosphere: if you want something a bit more loud and fun you will be pretty disappointed. If you find places like Baekjeong, Samwon Garden, or Cote to be way too noisy of a dinner experience then you will probably appreciate what Jongro has to offer.
